info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 6 at 9:34AM CDT until June 9 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Tulsa OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Bird Creek near Sperry affecting Tulsa and Osage Counties.
Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County.
Illinois River at Chewey affecting Adair, Delaware and Cherokee Counties.
Illinois River near Watts affecting Adair and Delaware Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Illinois River near Tahlequah.
* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, minor flooding occurs from near Hanging Rock downstream towards Tahlequah. Access roads east of the Combs Bridge near Eagles Bluff may be threatened. Extreme turbulence makes the river too hazardous for floating.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 13.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. This forecast includes rain that fell this morning and forecast rainfall for another thunderstorm complex that is expected late tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON
